<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Consult a specific Bulk of collection due date"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/pix-api/v2.x/bulkcobv/{id}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Endpoint to query a bulk of collection due date.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"examples":{"Exemplo":{"value":"1"}},"name":"id","description":"Bulk id","schema":{"format":"int64","type":"integer"},"in":"path","required":true}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>

the transaction identifier.\nThe purpose of this field is to be an element that enables the PSP of the receiver to present the user with the functionality of payment reconciliation.\nOn pacs.008, is referenced as `TransactionIdentification <txId>` or `idConciliacaoRecebedor`.\nThe txid field is limited to 35 characters in pacs.008.\nIn terms of workflow, txid is read by the payer's PSP application and, after payment is confirmed, it is sent to the SPI via pacs.008.\nA pacs.008 is also sent to the receiver's PSP, containing, besides all the usual payment information, the txid.\nWhen you notice a receiving with txid, the PSP of the receiver is able to communicate with the user receiver, informing that a specific payment has been settled.\nTxid is created exclusively by the receiving user and is under his responsibility.\nThe txid, in the context of representation of a collection, is unique by CPF/CNPJ of the receiver user.
